title: Function: filter_by_time
text: filter_by_time function Mealsuggestor package designed filter recipes based preparation cooking times. allows users specify minimum maximum limits preparation cooking times narrow recipe choices according time constraints.

title: Function: filter_by_time
text: data: data frame containing recipes. min_prep_time: Minimum allowed preparation time minutes. Default 0. max_prep_time: Maximum allowed preparation time minutes. Default Inf (infinity). min_cook_time: Minimum allowed cooking time minutes. Default 0. max_cook_time: Maximum allowed cooking time minutes. Default Inf.

title: Function: filter_by_time
text: function returns data frame containing recipes meet specified time criteria.

title: Function: filter_by_time
text: following example demonstrates use filter_by_time function filter recipes specific preparation cooking time constraints:
code: library(Mealsuggestor)  filtered_recipes <- filter_by_time(data = recipes,                                    min_prep_time = 10, max_prep_time = 30,                                    min_cook_time = 20, max_cook_time = 60)  # Display the filtered recipes print(filtered_recipes)

title: Function: get_recipes
text: get_recipes function Mealsuggestor package allows users filter recipes based various criteria, including ingredients, cuisine, diet. function ideal users want find recipes match specific dietary needs culinary preferences.

title: Function: get_recipes
text: data: data frame containing recipes. ingredients: vector ingredients filter recipes. NULL, filter applied. cuisine: string specifying cuisine type. NULL, filter applied. diet: string specifying diet type (e.g., Gluten-Free, Vegan). NULL, filter applied.

title: Function: get_recipes
text: function returns data frame containing recipes filtered based specified criteria.

title: Function: get_recipes
text: following example shows use get_recipes function filter recipes ingredients, cuisine, diet:
code: library(Mealsuggestor)  filtered_recipes <- get_recipes(recipes,                                 ingredients = c("tomato", "chicken"),                                 cuisine = "Italian",                                 diet = "Gluten Free")  # Display the filtered recipes print(filtered_recipes)

title: Function: random_recipe
text: random_recipe function Mealsuggestor package designed select random recipe dataset. function perfect users want bit surprise open trying something new without specific preferences mind.

title: Function: random_recipe
text: data: data frame containing recipes.

title: Function: random_recipe
text: function returns single randomly selected recipe provided dataset.

title: Function: random_recipe
text: following example shows use random_recipe function randomly select recipe dataset:
code: library(Mealsuggestor)  # Example dataset   randomly_selected_recipe <- random_recipe(data = recipes)  # Display the randomly selected recipe print(randomly_selected_recipe)

title: Function: sort_recipes
text: sort_recipes function Mealsuggestor package enables users sort recipes based specified criterion, rating preparation time. functionality essential organizing recipes according specific needs preferences.

title: Function: sort_recipes
text: data: data frame containing recipes. sort_by: column name sort (e.g., “rating”, “prep_time”). ascending: TRUE, sorts ascending order, else descending order. Default TRUE.

title: Function: sort_recipes
text: function returns sorted data frame recipes based specified criteria.

title: Function: sort_recipes
text: following example demonstrates use sort_recipes function sort recipes rating descending order:
code: library(Mealsuggestor)  sorted_recipes <- sort_recipes(data = recipes, sort_by = "rating", ascending = FALSE)  # Display the sorted recipes print(sorted_recipes)

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: vignette provides step--step guide use Meal Suggestor Shiny app included Mealsuggestor package. app allows users explore meal recipes based various criteria like cuisine, diet, preparation time, specific ingredients.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: installed, load package run app:
code: #library(Mealsuggestor) #mealApp()

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Follow steps navigate use Meal Suggestor app effectively:

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Choose Cuisine: Select preferred cuisine dropdown menu. Select Diet: Choose diet type (e.g., vegetarian, vegan). Enter Ingredients: Optionally, input specific ingredients want include.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Preparation Time: Set range desired preparation time. Cooking Time: Choose cooking time range.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Sort Recipes: Select sorting criteria (e.g., rating, prep time). View List: meal list updates based selections.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Select Meal: Click meal title view details. Read Meal Information app displays detailed information including ingredients cooking instructions.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Random Meal: Click “know want…” random suggestion. Clear Selections: Use “Clear Selections” button reset fields.

title: Using the Meal Suggestor Shiny App
text: Meal Suggestor Shiny app Mealsuggestor package offers interactive user-friendly way discover meal recipes tailored preferences. following steps, users can easily navigate app find meal ideas match dietary needs time constraints.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Samy Maurer. Author, maintainer. Zhiqi Freng. Author. Efthimis Katsiapis. Author. Shuangfei Li. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Maurer S, Freng Z, Katsiapis E, Li S (2023). Mealsuggestor: Recipe Filtering Suggestion Tool. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Mealsuggestor: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool},   author = {Samy Maurer and Zhiqi Freng and Efthimis Katsiapis and Shuangfei Li},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: Welcome Meal Suggestor package! R package designed make meal planning easier enjoyable. Utilizing comprehensive dataset diverse recipes, package offers tailored meal suggestions based user preferences cuisine type, dietary restrictions, preparation time. Whether cooking enthusiast just looking daily meal inspiration, package help explore world culinary possibilities.

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: Found dataset Kaggle, whcih contains 8000 food recipes cuisines across globe (major focus Indian Dishes). dataset, can get information food recipes, approximate cooking preparation times, cooking instructions,ingredients used, Recipe Author Ratings. , enhance readability analyzability dataset, preprocessing performed. Initially, unnecessary columns removed. Subsequently, certain columns underwent format conversion.

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: Cuisine Filter: Find meals specific cuisines like Mexican, Italian, Indian, . Dietary Considerations: Filter recipes based dietary needs vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free options. Preparation Cooking Time: Choose recipes based time available, quick snacks elaborate dinners. Ingredient-based Suggestions: Get recommendations based ingredients already home.

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: install Meal Suggestion package, use following command R:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ptds2023/MealSuggestion")

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: Meal Suggestor offers variety functions different needs preferences meal planning: filter_by_time() Use filter_by_time() find recipes matching available cooking preparation time. get_recipes() Discover recipes based combination criteria get_recipes(). get_top_n_recipes() Retrieve top-rated recipes using get_top_n_recipes(). random_recipe() Let random_recipe() surprise random meal suggestion. sort_recipes() Organize recipe search results sort_recipes() based criteria like preparation time rating.

what: Integrated Shiny App for Interactive Meal Planning
title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: Meal Suggestor also includes interactive Shiny app, enhancing meal planning experience. Launch R console input preferences receive meal suggestions:
code: # Launch the Shiny app for interactive meal planning launchMealApp()

title: Recipe Filtering and Suggestion Tool
text: website

text: contributions can help make Meal Suggestor even better! ideas new features, enhancements, find bugs, please visit GitHub repository contribute report issues.

text: data frame 6503 observations following 10 variables. recipe_title character vector rating numeric vector description character vector cuisine character vector course character vector diet character vector prep_time numeric vector cook_time numeric vector ingredients character vector instructions character vector

text: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/sarthak71/food-recipes/
